description: Number of self-avoiding walks on hexagonal lattice, with additional constraints.
comments: The hexagonal lattice is the familiar 2-dimensional lattice in which each point has 6 neighbors. This is sometimes called the triangular lattice.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: G. Nebe and N. J. A. Sloane, Home page for hexagonal (or triangular) lattice A2
S. Redner, Distribution functions in the interior of polymer chains, J. Phys. A 13 (1980), 3525-3541, doi:10.1088/0305-4470/13/11/023.
author: _Simon Plouffe_
